Column Comment.0: STRATIGRAPHIC NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphicname set.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area
Column Comment.3: AREA TYPE: The type of area described, such as country, province, basin, project,business area etc.
Column Comment.4: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.5: CERTIFIED INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that the stratigraphic name sethas been certified by the responsible organization, and may be used. Uncertifiedname sets may include name sets for a work in progress, informal name sets etc.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date that the strat name set become effective.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRED DATE: the date that the stratigraphic name set expired or was no longer ineffect.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A yes / no flag indicating that the stratigraphic name setis a preferred version, and should be used by default.
Column Comment.10: REMARK: narrative remarks about the stratigraphic name set.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: STRATIGRAPHIC NAME SET NAME: a unique name of the the set of stratigrapahicnames to which the STRAT UNITS belong. A stratigraphic name set is a collection ofstratigraphic units, such as may be in use for a geographic area, a project, acompanyetc.
Column Comment.13: STRATIGRAPHIC NAME SET TYPE: the type of name set, such as vendor,scientific, working, corporate, lexicon etc.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
